title.value: Повышение эффективности использования протеина рапсовых кормов и его влияние на молочную продуктивность коров
Increase of efficiency of protein use from rape forages and its influence on dairy efficiency of cows
Increase of efficiency of protein use from rape forages and its influence on dairy efficiency of cows

journal.title: Agriculture - Problems and Prospects : collection of scientific papers

person.name: Letunovich, E.V., Vitebsk State Academy of Veterinary Medicine (Belarus)

abstract.value: As a result of introduction in diets of first calf heifers and cows on the 2nd and 3rd month of lactation of a power-protein additive with a 'protected' protein on the rape basis raises the number of non cleavable fraction of protein for 16,2-17,5%, thus daily average of milking yield increases for 5,6-12,1%, and in terms of 4% milk fatness - for 9,1-13,1% in connection with increasing in milk fatness on 4,9-12,1%. Usage in diets of cows of a power-protein additive raises transformation of energy of feed in production for 9.3-10.9 and 13%. Feeding of a power-protein additive with the 'protected' protein provides a profit counting on 1 ruble of expenses at a rate of 1-3.7 Belarusian rubles. The consumption of power and crude protein on milk manufacture at feeding of energy protein additives decrease on 8,1-10,3 and 8,5-10,3%.
